dublinCore.dc:title: 117 S651 IS: Unplug the Electric Vehicle Charging Stations Programs Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Ernst (for herself, Mr. Sheehy, and Mr. Scott of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To repeal programs relating to funding for electric vehicle charging infrastructure, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Unplug the Electric Vehicle Charging Stations Programs Act.

section.header: Repeal of charging and fueling infrastructure grants

subsection.text: Section 11101(b) of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58; 135 Stat. 444) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (D) through (G) as subparagraphs (C) through (F), respectively; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)(B), by striking paragraph (1)(G) and inserting paragraph (1)(F).

subsection.text: Section 151 of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (e)(2), by striking , including through funds awarded through the grant program under subsection (f),; and

section.header: Repeal of National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Formula Program

subsection.text: The unobligated amounts made available under paragraph (2) in the matter under the heading highway infrastructure programs under the heading Federal Highway Administration under the heading Department of Transportation in title VIII of division J of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58; 135 Stat. 1419) are rescinded.
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, beginning on the date of enactment of this Act—

paragraph.text: the program under paragraph (2) in the matter under the heading highway infrastructure programs under the heading Federal Highway Administration under the heading Department of Transportation in title VIII of division J of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58; 135 Stat. 1419) is terminated; and
no funds may used to carry out that program.
